On 9/22/05, Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> > The problem is that Cl=
assDefNotFoundError is usually (in my
> > experience) thrown as a result of=
 an error in a static
> > initializer.
>
> That's one possibility. Another =
is a missing class file. Really.

In my experience, a missing class file re=
sults in a
ClassNotFoundException. ClassDefNotFoundError is thrown when you=
 _can_
find the class, but not a resulting definition.

It occurs to me tha=
t it could also be thrown if the class on disk is
corrupted... the class wo=
uld be found, but no definition within it
would be loaded.
